title: Superb Aston Villa record first away Premier League win since 2015 with victory over injury-ravaged Norwich City
text:
This was a performance fit for the future king, as the Duke of Cambridge’s visit to Carrow Road to watch his beloved Aston Villa was richly rewarded.

Villa’s first away win in the Premier League since August 2015 could not have been more emphatic, as a Norwich team ravaged by injuries were ruthlessly blown away in front of Prince William and his family.

It has been a frustrating start on Villa’s return to this rarefied level, with performances not always yielding points, but this was a majestic display and their best since promotion from the Championship.

Wesley Moraes, the joint record £21 million summer signing, scored twice and had a first-half penalty saved while there were also outstanding goals from captain Jack Grealish, Conor Hourihane and substitute Douglas Luiz.

“I’ll have to get him [the Duke of Cambridge] a ticket for the next game,” said Dean Smith, Villa’s head coach. “I didn’t know he was coming but it was great to put on a performance like that for him.

"This has been coming and it’s nice it all came together. To come here and win as convincingly as we did is really pleasing."
description: This was a performance fit for the future king, as the Duke of Cambridge’s visit to Carrow Road to watch his beloved Aston Villa was richly rewarded.
